          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Good morning, everyone! It's lovely to see you all.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and observant individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is at a market with friends, enjoying coffee and pastries. They are planning to watch a soccer game between Moldova and Monaco later that evening at The Queen's Arms pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a pleasant morning at a market with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in friendly conversation with his friends, enjoying the market atmosphere and the company.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with social isolation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual with a history of social isolation and a desire for connection.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to engage with his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps overcoming some of his past tendencies towards isolation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with social isolation.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White.   • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to walk to The Queen's Arms pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he watched from the sidelines as his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, laughed and joked, tossing a football around in the park. He longed to join them, but a knot of resentment tightened in his chest, a bitter reminder of his own clumsiness and the way the other boys always seemed to pick him last for teams. He retreated to the familiar comfort of the bus stop bench, the cold metal a stark contrast to the warmth of the camaraderie he craved.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and plans to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Queen's Arms pub later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could get up and walk to The Queen's Arms pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and anticipatory mood, about to head to a pub to watch a football game with some friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation while soaking up the sunshine.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and observant individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and observant individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and knowledgeable, happy to engage in conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a compassionate and empathetic person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be actively engaging in conversation and enjoying the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and knowledgeable, happy to engage in conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a compassionate and empathetic person who values friendship and enjoys spending time with loved ones.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be actively engaging in conversation and enjoying the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Red Lion to watch the game, hoping her friends will join her.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a cynical working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a cynical working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a cynical working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a cynical working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Red Lion

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to engage with his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps overcoming some of his past tendencies towards isolation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with social isolation.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to engage with his friends and enjoy their company.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is the best place to watch the game, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to engage with his friends and enjoy their company.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with social isolation.

        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to engage with his friends and enjoy their company, perhaps overcoming some of his past tendencies towards isolation.

Alexander White just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you considered The Red Lion? They have better beer.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with social isolation.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to engage with his friends and enjoy their company.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, or Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with social isolation.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to engage with his friends and enjoy their company.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player

      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's so lovely out here, isn't it? I can't think of a better way to spend a sunny afternoon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game tonight. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "It really is lovely out here. I was thinking we could all go to The Red Lion tonight for the game. They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is fine by me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is alright, but have you considered The Red Lion? They have better beer.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy catching the game tonight? The Queen's Arms is usually pretty good.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms is the best place to watch the game, lads.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and has a preference for The Queen's Arms.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms or he could go to a different pub.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player

      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms sounds good to me.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a cynical working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
